title: 105_hr120
content:
The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends definitions in title 11 of the United States Code. It adjusts dollar amounts. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 makes adjustments to dollar amounts, extends time limits, imposes penalties for negligent or fraudulent bankruptcy petition preparation, revises eligibility criteria for trustees, and addresses the employment of professional persons. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 includes amendments to the employment and compensation of professional persons involved in bankruptcy cases. These changes affect the authority and limitations on compensation for attorneys and accountants providing professional services. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends compensation provisions for professional persons in bankruptcy cases. Changes include limitations on compensation basis, officer compensation, special tax provisions, conversion effects, and automatic stay. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 includes amendments to special tax provisions, conversion effects, automatic stay, and executory contracts and unexpired leases in bankruptcy cases. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts, default arising from failure to perform nonmonetary obligations, and the removal of certain paragraphs in subsections. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. Amends the item relating to section 556 to include contractual right to liquidate commodities contract or forward contract.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) to include subparagraphs before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed".

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amends section 522 of title 11, United States Code, by adjusting liability designations and references. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Amends Section 523 of title 11, United States Code by adding exceptions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Also specifies conditions for debts imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. Additionally corrects a typographical error in subsection (e). SEC. 17. Amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code regarding the effect of discharge in bankruptcy cases. 

SEC. 18. Amends Section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code to provide protection against discriminatory treatment in bankruptcy proceedings.

SEC. 19. Amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, United States Code related to property of the estate in bankruptcy cases.

SEC. 20. Amends Section 546 of title 11, United States Code regarding limitations on avoiding powers in bankruptcy proceedings.

SEC. 21. Addresses the liability of transferee of avoided transfer in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 20 amends Section 546 of title 11, United States Code, regarding limitations on avoiding powers in bankruptcy proceedings. SEC. 21 addresses the liability of transferee of avoided transfer in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 22 pertains to setoff. SEC. 22. Setoff. Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``362(b)(14)'' and inserting ``362(b)(17)''. SEC. 23. Disposition of property of the estate. Section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``1009,''. SEC. 24. General provisions. Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``1123(d),'' after ``1123(b),''. SEC. 25. Appointment of elected trustee. SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE.

Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to allow for the election of a trustee by creditors, with provisions for certification by the United States trustee and dispute resolution by the court. SEC. 26-31 amend various sections of title 11, United States Code, related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. Amendments include changing references from one section to another and correcting subsection numbers. SEC. 30-33 amend sections of title 11, United States Code, regarding plan contents, discharge, bankruptcy cases, and the bankruptcy review commission. Amendments involve changing subsection numbers and references within the code. SEC. 32 amends Section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code by changing references from "this subsection" to "subsection (c)". SEC. 33 modifies Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by renumbering subsections. SEC. 34 updates Section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code by clarifying terms related to bankruptcy law violations. SEC. 35 states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
